revised_title: Investigating the Magnetism of Metallic Titanium and its Contamination with Iron
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, examines the magnetism of metallic titanium and discovers that the apparent magnetism is due to the presence of iron impurities in the titanium. He compares the magnetic force of titanium with that of other magnetic metals like cobalt and nickel and concludes that titanium's magnetism is likely due to the contamination with iron.
